alert.note: Alert for Bristol Bay (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Watch issued December 31 at 5:40PM AKST until January 03 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...East to southeast winds 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 80 mph possible. * WHERE...Bristol Bay. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...High winds could move loose debris, damage property, and cause power outages. Travel could be difficult. Gusty winds may cause blowing and drifting of snow. Any blowing snow may significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A strong frontal system will allow southeasterly winds to increase beginning Tuesday morning. Winds will peak in intensity from west to east across coastal and interior Bristol Bay through Tuesday evening. Gusts to 65 mph are likely along the immediate coast through Tuesday night with gusts to 80 mph likely from Iliamna to Koliganek and New Stuyahok through Wednesday morning. Areas of blowing and drifting snow are possible during the onset of these winds. However, temperatures are expected to climb above freezing through the day Tuesday ending any threat of blowing snow and changing any snow falling to rain.
info.instruction: A high wind watch means there is potential for a hazardous high wind event. Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds.
